concept.title: Privacy, Security, and Governance
concept.shortdesc: The intention of privacy, security, and governance is to protect informaton and ensure rightful access.

conbody.p: Privacy, security, and governance are not all the same thing.

ul.li: Privacy is restricting information access to those who have the right to access it.
Security is the means by which you maintain privacy and protect information assets.
Governance is the set of processes, roles, policies, controls, and metrics that an organization develops and places around information to manage its security and privacy.

conbody.p: is designed from the ground up to be able to manage crucia aspects of privacy and security, and to accurately reflect your organization's governance policies.
